job_title: Community Support Specialist in Washington, DC
pros:
Great introduction into the mental health field.
Builds skills in terms of crisis management
Opportunities for growth and movement within the agency
The agency is growing in a positive direction
Flexibility and support for those continuing education
cons:
Heavy on documentation
Large workload
High turnover rate, largely due to the nature of the work

job_title: Community Support Specialist in Washington, DC
pros: Flexibility to support your overflowing caseload, focus on mental health
cons: High turnover rates, high case loads

pros: make your own schedule, that's it.
cons: Only care about billable hours to meet with client. The lack of training their staff doesn't allow someone to properly meet with client and bill the insurance company effectively. Staff go into sometimes dangerous areas where most of the population leave (understandable) but the pressure to meet with the client may get staff into compromising situation. Someone got bedbugs in their car for transporting client.

review_title: Expect too much for such little pay
job_title: Community Support Specialist in Washington, DC
pros: some Really good people that work for company
cons: Work culture is horrible. Pay is not enough to rationalize what they ask if employees. Turnover is too high.
